docs.text: Mod Help Moderation tools. slowmode Description: Changes thread's or text channel's slowmode setting. Interval can be anything from 0 seconds to 6 hours. Use without parameters to disable. Usage: ,slowmode userinfo Description: Show information about a user. This includes fields for status, discord join date, server join date, voice state and previous usernames/display names/nicknames. If the member has no roles, previous usernames, display names, or nicknames, these fields will be omitted. Usage: ,userinfo names Description: Show previous usernames, display names, and server nicknames of a member. Usage: ,names rename Description: Change a member's nickname. Leaving the nickname argument empty will remove it. Usage: ,rename kick Description: Kick a user. Examples: - [p]kick 428675506947227648 wanted to be kicked. This will kick the user with ID 428675506947227648 from the server. - [p]kick @Twentysix wanted to be kicked. This will kick Twentysix from the server. If a reason is specified, it will be the reason that shows up in the audit log. Usage: ,kick ban Description: Ban a user from this server and optionally delete days of messages. days is the amount of days of messages to cleanup on ban. Examples: - [p]ban 428675506947227648 7 Continued to spam after told to stop. This will ban the user with ID 428675506947227648 and it will delete 7 days worth of messages. - [p]ban @Twentysix 7 Continued to spam after told to stop. This will ban Twentysix and it will delete 7 days worth of messages. A user ID should be provided if the user is not a member of this server. If days is not a number, it's treated as the first word of the reason. Minimum 0 days, maximum 7. If not specified, the defaultdays setting will be used instead. Usage: ,ban massban Description: Mass bans user(s) from the server. days is the amount of days of messages to cleanup on massban. Example: - [p]massban 345628097929936898 57287406247743488 7 they broke all rules. This will ban all the added userids and delete 7 days worth of their messages. User IDs need to be provided in order to ban using this command. Usage: ,massban tempban Description: Temporarily ban a user from this server. duration is the amount of time the user should be banned for. days is the amount of days of messages to cleanup on tempban. Examples: - [p]tempban @Twentysix Because I say so This will ban Twentysix for the default amount of time set by an administrator. - [p]tempban @Twentysix 15m You need a timeout This will ban Twentysix for 15 minutes. - [p]tempban 428675506947227648 1d2h15m 5 Evil person This will ban the user with ID 428675506947227648 for 1 day 2 hours 15 minutes and will delete the last 5 days of their messages. Usage: ,tempban softban Description: Kick a user and delete 1 day's worth of their messages. Example: - [p]softban 345628097929936898 Hacked account This will kick the user with ID 345628097929936898 and delete 1 day's worth of their messages. Usage: ,softban voicekick Description: Kick a member from a voice channel. Usage: ,voicekick voiceunban Description: Unban a user from speaking and listening in the server's voice channels. Usage: ,voiceunban voiceban Description: Ban a user from speaking and listening in the server's voice channels. Usage: ,voiceban unban Description: Unban a user from this server. Requires specifying the target user's ID. To find this, you may either: 1. Copy it from the mod log case (if one was created), or 2. Enable Developer Mode, go to Bans in this server's settings, right-click the user and select 'Copy ID'. Usage: ,unban modset Description: Manage server administration settings. Usage: ,modset modset showsettings Description: Show the current server administration settings. Usage: ,modset showsettings modset defaultdays Description: Set the default number of days worth of messages to be deleted when a user is banned. The number of days must be between 0 and 7. Usage: ,modset defaultdays modset deletenames Description: Delete all stored usernames, display names, and nicknames. Examples: - [p]modset deletenames - Did not confirm. Shows the help message. - [p]modset deletenames yes - Deletes all stored usernames, display names, and nicknames. Arguments <confirmation> This will default to false unless specified. Usage: ,modset deletenames modset deleterepeats Description: Enable auto-deletion of repeated messages. Must be between 2 and 20. Set to -1 to disable this feature. Usage: ,modset deleterepeats modset defaultduration Description: Set the default time to be used when a user is tempbanned. Accepts: seconds, minutes, hours, days, weeks duration must be greater than zero. Examples: [p]modset defaultduration 7d12h10m [p]modset defaultduration 7 days 12 hours 10 minutes Usage: ,modset defaultduration modset hierarchy Description: Toggle role hierarchy check for mods and admins. WARNING : Disabling this setting will allow mods to take actions on users above them in the role hierarchy! This is enabled by default. Usage: ,modset hierarchy modset reinvite Description: Toggle whether an invite will be sent to a user when unbanned. If this is True, the bot will attempt to create and send a single-use invite to the newly-unbanned user. Usage: ,modset reinvite modset tracknicknames Description: Toggle whether nickname changes should be tracked. This setting will be overridden if trackallnames is disabled. Usage: ,modset tracknicknames modset mentionspam Description: Manage the automoderation settings for mentionspam. Usage: ,modset mentionspam modset mentionspam strict Description: Setting to account for duplicate mentions. If enabled all mentions will count including duplicated mentions. If disabled only unique mentions will count. Use this command without any parameter to see current setting. Usage: ,modset mentionspam strict modset mentionspam warn Description: Sets the autowarn conditions for mention spam. Users will be warned if they send any messages which contain more than <max_mentions> mentions. <max_mentions> Must be 0 or greater. Set to 0 to disable this feature. Usage: ,modset mentionspam warn modset mentionspam kick Description: Sets the autokick conditions for mention spam. Users will be kicked if they send any messages which contain more than <max_mentions> mentions. <max_mentions> Must be 0 or greater. Set to 0 to disable this feature. Usage: ,modset mentionspam kick modset mentionspam ban Description: Set the autoban conditions for mention spam. Users will be banned if they send any message which contains more than <max_mentions> mentions. <max_mentions> Must be 0 or greater. Set to 0 to disable this feature. Usage: ,modset mentionspam ban modset dm Description: Toggle whether a message should be sent to a user when they are kicked/banned. If this option is enabled, the bot will attempt to DM the user with the guild name and reason as to why they were kicked/banned. Usage: ,modset dm modset trackallnames Description: Toggle whether all name changes should be tracked. Toggling this off also overrides the tracknicknames setting. Usage: ,modset trackallnames moveignoredchannels Description: Move ignored channels and servers to core Usage: ,moveignoredchannels movedeletedelay Description: Move deletedelay settings to core Usage: ,movedeletedelay

docs.text: Description: Changes thread's or text channel's slowmode setting. Interval can be anything from 0 seconds to 6 hours. Use without parameters to disable. Usage: ,slowmode
docs.title: slowmode

docs.text: Description: Show information about a user. This includes fields for status, discord join date, server join date, voice state and previous usernames/display names/nicknames. If the member has no roles, previous usernames, display names, or nicknames, these fields will be omitted. Usage: ,userinfo
docs.title: userinfo

docs.text: Description: Show previous usernames, display names, and server nicknames of a member. Usage: ,names
docs.title: names

docs.text: Description: Change a member's nickname. Leaving the nickname argument empty will remove it. Usage: ,rename
docs.title: rename

docs.text: Description: Kick a user. Examples: - [p]kick 428675506947227648 wanted to be kicked. This will kick the user with ID 428675506947227648 from the server. - [p]kick @Twentysix wanted to be kicked. This will kick Twentysix from the server. If a reason is specified, it will be the reason that shows up in the audit log. Usage: ,kick
docs.title: kick

docs.text: Description: Ban a user from this server and optionally delete days of messages. days is the amount of days of messages to cleanup on ban. Examples: - [p]ban 428675506947227648 7 Continued to spam after told to stop. This will ban the user with ID 428675506947227648 and it will delete 7 days worth of messages. - [p]ban @Twentysix 7 Continued to spam after told to stop. This will ban Twentysix and it will delete 7 days worth of messages. A user ID should be provided if the user is not a member of this server. If days is not a number, it's treated as the first word of the reason. Minimum 0 days, maximum 7. If not specified, the defaultdays setting will be used instead. Usage: ,ban
docs.title: ban

docs.text: Description: Mass bans user(s) from the server. days is the amount of days of messages to cleanup on massban. Example: - [p]massban 345628097929936898 57287406247743488 7 they broke all rules. This will ban all the added userids and delete 7 days worth of their messages. User IDs need to be provided in order to ban using this command. Usage: ,massban
docs.title: massban

docs.text: Description: Temporarily ban a user from this server. duration is the amount of time the user should be banned for. days is the amount of days of messages to cleanup on tempban. Examples: - [p]tempban @Twentysix Because I say so This will ban Twentysix for the default amount of time set by an administrator. - [p]tempban @Twentysix 15m You need a timeout This will ban Twentysix for 15 minutes. - [p]tempban 428675506947227648 1d2h15m 5 Evil person This will ban the user with ID 428675506947227648 for 1 day 2 hours 15 minutes and will delete the last 5 days of their messages. Usage: ,tempban
docs.title: tempban

docs.text: Description: Kick a user and delete 1 day's worth of their messages. Example: - [p]softban 345628097929936898 Hacked account This will kick the user with ID 345628097929936898 and delete 1 day's worth of their messages. Usage: ,softban
docs.title: softban

docs.text: ModLog Help Browse and manage modlog cases. To manage modlog settings, use [p]modlogset . case Description: Show the specified case. Usage: ,case casesfor Description: Display cases for the specified member. Usage: ,casesfor listcases Description: List cases for the specified member. docs.text: MsgTracker Help Tracks how many messages people send. Idea prompted by Esports Discord, specifically Frostyy#1313 (526672641701183509) mtset Description: Message Count Settings. Members are allowed to deny permission from being tracked for privacy reasons unless the Bot Owner sets differently. Usage: ,mtset mtset enable Description: Enables / Disables system. This will do it automatically based on what the previous setting is. Usage: ,mtset enable mtset channellist Description: Displays channels that are being ignored from tracking. Thank you Core Red Usage: ,mtset channellist mtset admin Description: Administration commands. Allows you to nuke someone's history from record or adjust their count. Usage: ,mtset admin mtset admin deletecount Description: Will delete the member's entire record. Will ask for confirmation if you want to do this. Usage: ,mtset admin deletecount mtset admin cache Description: [BOT OWNER] Check cached messages counter for this server. Usage: ,mtset admin cache mtset admin resetguild Description: Will delete Guild's recorded members. Will ask for confirmation if you want to do this. Usage: ,mtset admin resetguild mtset admin updateconfig Description: [BOT OWNER] Updates to config manually Usage: ,mtset admin updateconfig mtset admin nukeconfig Description: [BOT OWNER] Nukes all recorded counters. This will nuke every messages that's been counted. Do so at your own risk. Usage: ,mtset admin nukeconfig mtset admin counter Description: Change a member's recorded message count. Usage: ,mtset admin counter mtset admin blockignore Description: [BOT OWNER] Disables [p]trackignore command for users Usage: ,mtset admin blockignore mtset showsettings Description: Display guild specific settings. This will not display blocked users, please use [p]mtset ignorelist . This will not display ignored channels, please use [p]mtset channellist . Usage: ,mtset showsettings mtset userlist Description: Displays users who are being ignored from tracking. Thank you Core Red Usage: ,mtset userlist mtset ignore Description: Ignore users / channels from message tracking. Usage: ,mtset ignore mtset ignore user Description: This blocks the user(s) from being tracked. To remove someone from the list, use the command again with the same user. Members will have access to a command that lets them do it themselves if they so choose. Usage: ,mtset ignore user mtset ignore channel Description: This will ignore/unignore a channel from message tracking. If a channel is added to the list, type it again to remove it. Usage: ,mtset ignore channel mtset ignore mods Description: Ignores/Unignores staff of a server. This will do it automatically based on what the previous setting is. Usage: ,mtset ignore mods trackignore Description: Ignore yourself from message tracking. If you want to be tracked for your message count, you will need to contact the staff of the current server. Usage: ,trackignore msgtop10 Description: Displays the top 10 members in the leaderboard Usage: ,msgtop10 messages Description: Displays how many messages the user has. If user is none, defaults to author. Thank you The Discord Historian#0666 ! Usage: ,messages msgleaderboard Description: Message Tracker Leaderboard, displays all the members. Credit to Core Economy Usage: ,msgleaderboard

docs.text: Mutes Help Mute users temporarily or indefinitely. voicemute Description: Mute a user in their current voice channel. <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [time_and_reason] is the time to mute for and reason. Time is any valid time length such as 30 minutes or 2 days . If nothing is provided the mute will use the set default time or indefinite if not set. Examples: [p]voicemute @member1 @member2 spam 5 hours [p]voicemute @member1 3 days Usage: ,voicemute voiceunmute Description: Unmute a user in their current voice channel. <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [reason] is the reason for the unmute. Usage: ,voiceunmute muteset Description: Mute settings. Usage: ,muteset muteset showmoderator Description: Decide whether the name of the moderator muting a user should be included in the DM to that user. Usage: ,muteset showmoderator muteset settings Description: Shows the current mute settings for this guild. Usage: ,muteset settings muteset makerole Description: Create a Muted role. This will create a role and apply overwrites to all available channels to more easily setup muting a user. If you already have a muted role created on the server use [p]muteset role ROLE_NAME_HERE Usage: ,muteset makerole muteset defaulttime Description: Set the default mute time for the mute command. If no time interval is provided this will be cleared. Usage: ,muteset defaulttime muteset notification Description: Set the notification channel for automatic unmute issues. If no channel is provided this will be cleared and notifications about issues when unmuting users will not be sent anywhere. Usage: ,muteset notification muteset senddm Description: Set whether mute notifications should be sent to users in DMs. Usage: ,muteset senddm muteset role Description: Sets the role to be applied when muting a user. If no role is setup the bot will attempt to mute a user by utilizing server timeouts. Note: If no role is setup a user may be able to leave the server and rejoin no longer being muted. Usage: ,muteset role activemutes Description: Displays active mutes on this server. Usage: ,activemutes timeout Description: Timeout users. <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [time_and_reason] is the time to mute for and reason. Time is any valid time length such as 30 minutes or 2 days . If nothing is provided the mute will use the set default time or indefinite if not set. Examples: [p]mute @member1 @member2 spam 5 hours [p]mute @member1 3 days Usage: ,timeout mute Description: Mute users. <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [time_and_reason] is the time to mute for and reason. Time is any valid time length such as 30 minutes or 2 days . If nothing is provided the mute will use the set default time or indefinite if not set. Examples: [p]mute @member1 @member2 spam 5 hours [p]mute @member1 3 days Usage: ,mute mutechannel Description: Mute a user in the current text channel (or in the parent of the current thread). <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [time_and_reason] is the time to mute for and reason. Time is any valid time length such as 30 minutes or 2 days . If nothing is provided the mute will use the set default time or indefinite if not set. Examples: [p]mutechannel @member1 @member2 spam 5 hours [p]mutechannel @member1 3 days Usage: ,mutechannel unmute Description: Unmute users. <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [reason] is the reason for the unmute. Usage: ,unmute unmutechannel Description: Unmute a user in this channel (or in the parent of this thread). <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [reason] is the reason for the unmute. Usage: ,unmutechannel

docs.text: Description: Sets the role to be applied when muting a user. If no role is setup the bot will attempt to mute a user by utilizing server timeouts. Note: If no role is setup a user may be able to leave the server and rejoin no longer being muted. Usage: ,muteset role
docs.title: muteset role

docs.text: Description: Displays active mutes on this server. Usage: ,activemutes
docs.title: activemutes

docs.text: Description: Timeout users. <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [time_and_reason] is the time to mute for and reason. Time is any valid time length such as 30 minutes or 2 days . If nothing is provided the mute will use the set default time or indefinite if not set. Examples: [p]mute @member1 @member2 spam 5 hours [p]mute @member1 3 days Usage: ,timeout
docs.title: timeout

docs.text: Description: Mute users. <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [time_and_reason] is the time to mute for and reason. Time is any valid time length such as 30 minutes or 2 days . If nothing is provided the mute will use the set default time or indefinite if not set. Examples: [p]mute @member1 @member2 spam 5 hours [p]mute @member1 3 days Usage: ,mute
docs.title: mute

docs.text: Description: Mute a user in the current text channel (or in the parent of the current thread). <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [time_and_reason] is the time to mute for and reason. Time is any valid time length such as 30 minutes or 2 days . If nothing is provided the mute will use the set default time or indefinite if not set. Examples: [p]mutechannel @member1 @member2 spam 5 hours [p]mutechannel @member1 3 days Usage: ,mutechannel
docs.title: mutechannel

docs.text: Description: Unmute users. <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [reason] is the reason for the unmute. Usage: ,unmute
docs.title: unmute

docs.text: Description: Unmute a user in this channel (or in the parent of this thread). <users...> is a space separated list of usernames, ID's, or mentions. [reason] is the reason for the unmute. Usage: ,unmutechannel
docs.title: unmutechannel

docs.text: NickNamer Help NickNamer nick Description: Forcibly change a user's nickname to a predefined string. Usage: ,nick cnick Description: Forcibly change a user's nickname. Usage: ,cnick freezenick Description: Freeze a users nickname. Usage: ,freezenick unfreezenick Description: Unfreeze a user's nickname. Usage: ,unfreezenick tempnick Description: Temporarily rename a user. IMPORTANT : For better performance, temporary nicknames are checked in a 10 minute intervall. Usage: ,tempnick nickset Description: Nicknamer settings Usage: ,nickset nickset name Description: Set the default name that will be applied when using [p]nick Usage: ,nickset name nickset modlog Description: Set if you would like to create a modlog entry everytime a nickname is being changed. Usage: ,nickset modlog nickset dm Description: Set if you would like the bot to DM the user who's nickname was changed. Usage: ,nickset dm nickpurge Description: Remove all nicknames in the server. Usage: ,nickpurge

docs.text: NitroRole Help Welcome new nitro boosters and/or give them a special role! nitrorole Description: Settings for NitroRole cog. Usage: ,nitrorole nitrorole removemessage Description: Remove new booster message. Usage: ,nitrorole removemessage nitrorole addmessage Description: Add new booster message. Those fields will get replaced automatically: $mention - Mention the user who boosted $username - The user's display name $server - The name of the server $count - The number of boosts server has (this isn't the same as amount of users that boost this server) $plural - Empty if count is 1. 's' otherwise Note: New booster message can also have image. To set it, use [p]nitrorole setimage Usage: ,nitrorole addmessage nitrorole unsetimage Description: Unset image for new booster message. Usage: ,nitrorole unsetimage nitrorole unassignonboostend Description: Set if booster role should be unassigned when someone stops boosting server. Leave empty to see current settings. Usage: ,nitrorole unassignonboostend nitrorole autoassignrole Description: Set role that will be autoassigned after someone boosts server. Leave empty to not assign any role. Usage: ,nitrorole autoassignrole nitrorole listmessages Description: List new booster message templates. Usage: ,nitrorole listmessages nitrorole channel Description: Set channel for new booster messages. Leave empty to disable. Usage: ,nitrorole channel nitrorole setimage Description: Set image for new booster message. Usage: ,nitrorole setimage
docs.title: NitroRole

docs.text: NoNuke Help Anti-Nuke System for lazy guild owners! Monitors the following events: Kicks & Bans Channel Creation/Edit/Deletion Role Creation/Edit/Deletion Emoji/Webhook Deletion Member role updates Set a cooldown(in seconds) Set an overload count(X events in X seconds) Set an action(kick, ban, strip, notify) If a user or bot exceeds X mod events within X seconds, the set action will be performed. Additionally, any dangerous permissions added to a role will be logged. nonuke Description: Anti-Nuke System for lazy guild owners! Monitors the following events: Kicks & Bans Channel Creation/Edit/Deletion Role Creation/Edit/Deletion Set a cooldown(in seconds) Set an overload count(X events in X seconds) Set an action(kick, ban, strip, notify) If a user or bot exceeds X mod events within X seconds, the set action will be performed Usage: ,nonuke nonuke dm Description: Toggle whether the bot sends the user a DM when a kick or ban action is performed Usage: ,nonuke dm nonuke action Description: Set the action for the bot to take when NoNuke is triggered Actions kick - kick the user ban - ban the user strip - strip all roles with permissions from user notify - just sends a report to the log channel Usage: ,nonuke action nonuke logchannel Description: Set the log channel for Anti-Nuke kicks Usage: ,nonuke logchannel nonuke whitelist Description: Add/Remove users from the whitelist Usage: ,nonuke whitelist nonuke enable Description: Enable/Disable the NoNuke system Usage: ,nonuke enable nonuke cooldown Description: Cooldown (in seconds) for NoNuke to trigger Usage: ,nonuke cooldown nonuke view Description: View the NoNuke settings Usage: ,nonuke view nonuke ignorebots Description: Toggle whether other bots are ignored NOTE: Bot specific roles (the role created when the bot joins) cannot be removed. If NoNuke is set to strip roles, and a bot triggers it while having an integrated role, NoNuke will fail to remove the role from it. Usage: ,nonuke ignorebots nonuke overload Description: How many mod actions can be done within the set cooldown Mod actions include: Kicks & Bans Channel Creation/Edit/Deletion Role Creation/Edit/Deletion Usage: ,nonuke overload
docs.title: NoNuke

Additionally, any dangerous permissions added to a role will be logged.

docs.text: Notes Help Store moderator notes on users setnote Description: Add a note to a user. The member argument is optional and defaults to the command invoker Usage: ,setnote allnotes Description: See all the notes ever taken in your server. This is a button based pagination session and each page contains a single user's notes Usage: ,allnotes notes Description: See all the notes of a user. The member argument is optional and defaults to the command invoker Usage: ,notes delnote Description: Delete a note of a user. The member argument is optional and defaults to the command invoker The id argument is the index of the note which can be checked with the [p]notes command Usage: ,delnote removenotes Description: Delete all notes of a user. The user argument is optional and defaults to the command invoker Usage: ,removenotes
docs.title: Notes

docs.text: Paginator Help A cog that paginates content and embed given by you. JSON example: https://pastebin.com/DiuFREBW YAML example: https://pastebin.com/e9ZvhYUn paginator Description: Commands to manage paginators. JSON example: https://pastebin.com/DiuFREBW YAML example: https://pastebin.com/e9ZvhYUn Usage: ,paginator paginator editpage Description: Edit a page in a paginator group. Usage: ,paginator editpage paginator create Description: Initiate a new paginator group. Usage: ,paginator create paginator raw Description: Get the raw JSON of a paginator group's page. Usage: ,paginator raw paginator addpage Description: Add a page to a paginator group. Usage: ,paginator addpage paginator addpage fromjson Description: Add a page to a paginator group. The page argument should be a pastebin link containing valid json. If index is not provided, the page will be added to the end of the paginator group. Otherwise, the page will be added at the specified index and the page on that index and all the pages after it will be shifted one index ahead. Example JSON: https://pastebin.com/DiuFREBW Usage: ,paginator addpage fromjson paginator addpage fromyaml Description: Add a page to a paginator group. The page argument should be a pastebin link containing valid yaml. If index is not provided, the page will be added to the end of the paginator group. Otherwise, the page will be added at the specified index and the page on that index and all the pages after it will be shifted one index ahead. Example YAML: https://pastebin.com/e9ZvhYUn Usage: ,paginator addpage fromyaml paginator info Description: Get information about a paginator group. Usage: ,paginator info paginator delete Description: Delete a paginator group. Usage: ,paginator delete paginator list Description: List all paginator groups in the server. Usage: ,paginator list paginator removepage Description: Remove a page from a paginator group. Usage: ,paginator removepage paginator start Description: Starts a paginator of the given group name Usage: ,paginator start
docs.title: Paginator

docs.text: Permissions Help Customise permissions for commands and cogs. permissions Description: Command permission management tools. Usage: ,permissions permissions setdefaultglobalrule Description: Set the default global rule for a command. This is the rule a command will default to when no other rule is found. <allow_or_deny> should be one of "allow", "deny" or "clear". "clear" will reset the default rule. <cog_or_command> is the cog or command to set the default rule for. This is case sensitive. Usage: ,permissions setdefaultglobalrule permissions addglobalrule Description: Add a global rule to a command. <allow_or_deny> should be one of "allow" or "deny". <cog_or_command> is the cog or command to add the rule to. This is case sensitive. <who_or_what...> is one or more users, channels or roles the rule is for. Usage: ,permissions addglobalrule permissions removeserverrule Description: Remove a server rule from a command. <cog_or_command> is the cog or command to remove the rule from. This is case sensitive. <who_or_what...> is one or more users, channels or roles the rule is for. Usage: ,permissions removeserverrule permissions clearserverrules Description: Reset all rules in this server. Usage: ,permissions clearserverrules permissions acl Description: Manage permissions with YAML files. Usage: ,permissions acl permissions acl setserver Description: Set rules for this server with a YAML file. WARNING : This will override reset all rules in this server to the rules specified in the uploaded file. Usage: ,permissions acl setserver permissions acl updateglobal Description: Update global rules with a YAML file. This won't touch any rules not specified in the YAML file. Usage: ,permissions acl updateglobal permissions acl getserver Description: Get a YAML file detailing all rules in this server. Usage: ,permissions acl getserver permissions acl getglobal Description: Get a YAML file detailing all global rules. Usage: ,permissions acl getglobal permissions acl updateserver Description: Update rules for this server with a YAML file. This won't touch any rules not specified in the YAML file. Usage: ,permissions acl updateserver permissions acl setglobal Description: Set global rules with a YAML file. WARNING : This will override reset all global rules to the rules specified in the uploaded file. This does not validate the names of commands and cogs before setting the new rules. Usage: ,permissions acl setglobal permissions acl yamlexample Description: Sends an example of the yaml layout for permissions Usage: ,permissions acl yamlexample permissions removeglobalrule Description: Remove a global rule from a command. <cog_or_command> is the cog or command to remove the rule from. This is case sensitive. <who_or_what...> is one or more users, channels or roles the rule is for. Usage: ,permissions removeglobalrule permissions addserverrule Description: Add a rule to a command in this server. <allow_or_deny> should be one of "allow" or "deny". <cog_or_command> is the cog or command to add the rule to. This is case sensitive. <who_or_what...> is one or more users, channels or roles the rule is for. Usage: ,permissions addserverrule permissions explain Description: Explain how permissions works. Usage: ,permissions explain permissions clearglobalrules Description: Reset all global rules. Usage: ,permissions clearglobalrules permissions canrun Description: Check if a user can run a command. This will take the current context into account, such as the server and text channel. Usage: ,permissions canrun permissions setdefaultserverrule Description: Set the default rule for a command in this server. This is the rule a command will default to when no other rule is found. <allow_or_deny> should be one of "allow", "deny" or "clear". "clear" will reset the default rule. <cog_or_command> is the cog or command to set the default rule for. This is case sensitive. Usage: ,permissions setdefaultserverrule
docs.title: Permissions

docs.text: PersonalChannels Help Assign and edit personal channels. Bot needs manage_channels guild permissions to utilize this cog. mychannel Description: Control of personal channels. Usage: ,mychannel mychannel list Description: Assigned channels list. Usage: ,mychannel list mychannel unpin Description: Unpin a message from the personal channel. You can also reply to the message with invoking the command. Usage: ,mychannel unpin mychannel assign Description: Assign a personal text channel to someone. Usage: ,mychannel assign mychannel blacklist Description: Manage blacklisted names. Usage: ,mychannel blacklist mychannel blacklist add Description: Add channel name to blacklist. Members will not be able to change name to blacklisted names. Usage: ,mychannel blacklist add mychannel blacklist remove Description: Remove channel name from blacklist. Usage: ,mychannel blacklist remove mychannel blacklist list Description: List of blacklisted channel names. Usage: ,mychannel blacklist list mychannel pin Description: Pin a message in the personal channel. You can also reply to the message with invoking the command. Usage: ,mychannel pin mychannel create Description: Create a personal channel and assign it to the user. <perms> : give the user permissions on how many users they want to add in their channel. Usage: ,mychannel create mychannel perms Description: Give users permissions on how many users they can to add in their channel. Run this command without the perms argument to clear the permission config. Usage: ,mychannel perms mychannel name Description: Change name of personal channel. You cant use blacklisted names. Usage: ,mychannel name mychannel unassign Description: Unassign personal text channel from someone. Usage: ,mychannel unassign mychannel position Description: Edit the channel position for someone's personal channel. Usage: ,mychannel position mychannel delete Description: Delete your personal channel. Usage: ,mychannel delete mychannel topic Description: Change the topic of personal channel. You can't use blacklisted words. Usage: ,mychannel topic mychannel category Description: Configure the category every personal text channel should be under. Usage: ,mychannel category mychannel friends Description: Add or remove friends from your channel. <add_or_remove> should be either add to add or remove to remove friends. Usage: ,mychannel friends mychannel friends list Description: List your added friends. Usage: ,mychannel friends list mychannel remove Description: Delete member's personal channel. Usage: ,mychannel remove
docs.title: PersonalChannels

docs.text: PhenUtils Help Various developer utilities. do Description: Repeats a command a specified number of times. --sleep <int> is an optional flag specifying how much time to wait between command invocations. Usage: ,do execute Description: Execute multiple commands at once. Split them using |. Usage: ,execute bypass Description: Bypass a command's checks and cooldowns. Usage: ,bypass timing Description: Run a command timing execution and catching exceptions. Usage: ,timing schedulecmd Description: Schedule a command to be done later. Usage: ,schedulecmd reinvoke Description: Reinvoke a command message. You may reply to a message to reinvoke it or pass a message ID/link. Usage: ,reinvoke loglevel Description: Set the log output level. Usage: ,loglevel
docs.title: PhenUtils

docs.text: Pinboard Help Make pinned messages communal! Users can add and remove their contributions to a pinned message at any time. pinboard Description: Change the list of active pinned messages Usage: ,pinboard pinboard remove Description: Remove your own content to a pinned message Usage: ,pinboard remove pinboard add Description: Add or edit your own content to a pinned message Usage: ,pinboard add setpinboard Description: Change the list of active pinned messages Usage: ,setpinboard setpinboard list Description: List all pinned messages Usage: ,setpinboard list setpinboard add Description: Create a new pinned message pinnedMsgName is a label for the pinned message, so that you/others can easily refer back to it later. It should be a single word and short/easy to remember. Usage: ,setpinboard add setpinboard import Description: Import data Usage: ,setpinboard import setpinboard reset Description: ⚠️ Reset all pinned messages Type [p]setpinboard reset True if you're really sure. Usage: ,setpinboard reset setpinboard edit Description: Edit description of a pinned message Usage: ,setpinboard edit setpinboard update Description: Update one or all pinned messages Usage: ,setpinboard update setpinboard remove Description: Remove a pinned message The message stays behind, but it will be removed from the tracking system, so you can't update it anymore. Usage: ,setpinboard remove
docs.title: Pinboard

docs.text: Prefix Help Prefix management. prefix Description: Manage server prefixes. Running this command without subcommands will show this server's prefixes. Example: [p]prefix Usage: ,prefix prefix clear Description: Reset this server's prefixes to the default list. This cannot be undone. Example: [p]prefix clear Usage: ,prefix clear prefix remove Description: Remove a prefix from this server's prefix list. Use quotes to remove a prefix with spaces. Examples: [p]prefix remove ~ [p]prefix - "Alexa, " Usage: ,prefix remove prefix add Description: Add a prefix to this server's prefix list. Use quotes to add a prefix with spaces. Examples: [p]prefix add ? [p]prefix + "[botname], can you please " Usage: ,prefix add prefix set Description: Set the prefixes for this server. Multiple prefixes can be set at once. To add a prefix with spaces, use quotes. This will overwrite any current prefixes. Examples: [p]prefix set ! n! [p]prefix set .. & "Hey siri, " Usage: ,prefix set
docs.title: Prefix

docs.text: Pterodactyl Help Pterodactyl allows you to manage your Pterodactyl Panel from Discord. pterodactyl Description: No description provided. Usage: ,pterodactyl pterodactyl command Description: No description provided. Usage: ,pterodactyl command pterodactyl players Description: No description provided. Usage: ,pterodactyl players pterodactyl power Description: No description provided. Usage: ,pterodactyl power pterodactyl Description: Pterodactyl allows you to manage your Pterodactyl Panel from Discord. Usage: ,pterodactyl pterodactyl power Description: Send power actions to the server. Usage: ,pterodactyl power pterodactyl power stop Description: Stop the server. Usage: ,pterodactyl power stop pterodactyl power restart Description: Restart the server. Usage: ,pterodactyl power restart pterodactyl power kill Description: Kill the server. Usage: ,pterodactyl power kill pterodactyl power start Description: Start the server. Usage: ,pterodactyl power start pterodactyl config Description: Configure Pterodactyl settings. Usage: ,pterodactyl config pterodactyl config api Description: Set the API endpoint for retrieving user avatars. This is only used for retrieving user avatars for webhook messages. See PlayerDB for valid endpoints. Usually, you should leave this as default. Usage: ,pterodactyl config api pterodactyl config chat Description: Configure chat settings. Usage: ,pterodactyl config chat pterodactyl config chat channel Description: Set the channel to send chat output to. Usage: ,pterodactyl config chat channel pterodactyl config chat command Description: Set the command that will be used to send messages from Discord. Required placeholders: .$U (username), .$M (message), .$C (color) See documentation for more information. Usage: ,pterodactyl config chat command pterodactyl config topic Description: Set the topic for the console and chat channels. Usage: ,pterodactyl config topic pterodactyl config topic text Description: Set the text for the console and chat channels. Available placeholders: - .$H (hostname) - .$O (port) Available for Minecraft servers: - .$I (ip) - .$M (max players) - .$P (players online) - .$V (version) - .$D (description / Message of the Day) Usage: ,pterodactyl config topic text pterodactyl config topic host Description: Set the hostname or IP address of your server. Usage: ,pterodactyl config topic host pterodactyl config topic port Description: Set the port of your server. Usage: ,pterodactyl config topic port pterodactyl config serverid Description: Set the ID of your server. Usage: ,pterodactyl config serverid pterodactyl config messages Description: Configure message settings. Usage: ,pterodactyl config messages pterodactyl config messages shutdown Description: Set the message that will be sent when the server stops. Usage: ,pterodactyl config messages shutdown pterodactyl config messages startup Description: Set the message that will be sent when the server starts. Usage: ,pterodactyl config messages startup pterodactyl config messages join Description: Set the message that will be sent when a user joins the server. This is only shown in embeds. Usage: ,pterodactyl config messages join pterodactyl config messages leave Description: Set the message that will be sent when a user leaves the server. This is only shown in embeds. Usage: ,pterodactyl config messages leave pterodactyl config console Description: Configure console settings. Usage: ,pterodactyl config console pterodactyl config console commands Description: Enable or disable console commands. Usage: ,pterodactyl config console commands pterodactyl config console channel Description: Set the channel to send console output to. Usage: ,pterodactyl config console channel pterodactyl config view Description: View the current configuration. Usage: ,pterodactyl config view pterodactyl config regex Description: Set regex patterns. Usage: ,pterodactyl config regex pterodactyl config regex server Description: Set the regex pattern to match server messages on the server. See documentation for more information. Usage: ,pterodactyl config regex server pterodactyl config regex blacklist Description: Blacklist regex patterns. Usage: ,pterodactyl config regex blacklist pterodactyl config regex blacklist add Description: Add a regex pattern to the blacklist. Usage: ,pterodactyl config regex blacklist add pterodactyl config regex blacklist remove Description: Remove a regex pattern from the blacklist. Usage: ,pterodactyl config regex blacklist remove pterodactyl config regex join Description: Set the regex pattern to match join messages on the server. See documentation for more information. Usage: ,pterodactyl config regex join pterodactyl config regex leave Description: Set the regex pattern to match leave messages on the server. See documentation for more information. Usage: ,pterodactyl config regex leave pterodactyl config regex achievement Description: Set the regex pattern to match achievement messages on the server. See documentation for more information. Usage: ,pterodactyl config regex achievement pterodactyl config regex chat Description: Set the regex pattern to match chat messages on the server. See documentation for more information. Usage: ,pterodactyl config regex chat pterodactyl config ip Description: Mask the IP addresses of users in console messages. Usage: ,pterodactyl config ip pterodactyl config invite Description: Set the invite link for your server. Usage: ,pterodactyl config invite pterodactyl config url Description: Set the base URL of your Pterodactyl Panel. Please include the protocol (http/https). Example: https://panel.example.com Usage: ,pterodactyl config url pterodactyl command Description: Send a command to the server console. Usage: ,pterodactyl command pterodactyl players Description: Retrieve a list of players on the server. Usage: ,pterodactyl players

docs.text: Purge Help This cog contains commands used for "cleaning up" (deleting) messages. This is designed as a moderator tool and offers many convenient use cases. All cleanup commands only apply to the channel the command is executed in. Messages older than two weeks cannot be mass deleted. This is a limitation of the API. purge Description: Removes messages that meet a criteria. Messages older than 14 days cannot be deleted. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Example: - [p]purge 10 - [p] purge 2000 Usage: ,purge purge duplicates Description: Deletes duplicate messages in the channel from the last X messages and keeps only one copy. Arguments: - <number> The number of messages to check for duplicates. Must be a positive integer. Usage: ,purge duplicates purge embeds Description: Removes messages that have embeds in them. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge embeds 10 - [p]purge embeds 2000 Usage: ,purge embeds purge self Description: Removes your messages from the channel. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge self 10 - [p]purge self 2000 Usage: ,purge self purge links Description: Removes all messages containing a link. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge links 10 - [p]purge links 2000 Usage: ,purge links purge reactions Description: Removes all reactions from messages that have them. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge reactions 10 - [p]purge reactions 200 Usage: ,purge reactions purge custom Description: Remove messages that meet a criteria from the flags. The following flags are valid. user: Remove messages from the given user. contains: Remove messages that contain a substring. prefix: Remove messages that start with a string. suffix: Remove messages that end with a string. after: Search for messages that come after this message ID. before: Search for messages that come before this message ID. bot: yes Remove messages from bots. (not webhooks!) webhooks: yes Remove messages from webhooks. embeds: yes Remove messages that have embeds. files: yes Remove messages that have attachments. emoji: yes Remove messages that have custom emoji. reactions: yes Remove messages that have reactions. require: any or all Whether any or all flags should be met before deleting messages. Usage: ,purge custom purge regex Description: Removes messages that matches the regex pattern. Arguments: - <pattern> : The regex pattern to match. - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge regex (?i)(h(?:appy) 1 - [p]purge regex (?i)(h(?:appy) 10 Usage: ,purge regex purge user Description: Removes all messages by the member. Arguments: - <member> : The user to delete messages for. - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge user @member - [p]purge user @member 2000 Usage: ,purge user purge emoji Description: Removes all messages containing custom emoji. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge emoji 10 - [p]purge emoji 200 Usage: ,purge emoji purge bot Description: Removes bot messages, optionally takes a prefix argument. Arguments: - <prefix> : The bot's prefix you want to remove. - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. (Defaults to 100) - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge bot - [p]purge bot ? 2000 Usage: ,purge bot purge after Description: Delete all messages after a specified message. To get a message id, enable developer mode in Discord's settings, 'appearance' tab. Then right click a message and copy its id. Replying to a message will cleanup all messages after it. Arguments: - <message_id> The id of the message to cleanup after. This message won't be deleted. - <delete_pinned> Whether to delete pinned messages or not. Defaults to False Usage: ,purge after purge before Description: Deletes X messages before the specified message. To get a message id, enable developer mode in Discord's settings, 'appearance' tab. Then right click a message and copy its id. Replying to a message will cleanup all messages before it. Arguments: - <message_id> The id of the message to cleanup before. This message won't be deleted. - <number> The max number of messages to cleanup. Must be a positive integer. - <delete_pinned> Whether to delete pinned messages or not. Defaults to False Usage: ,purge before purge between Description: Delete the messages between Message One and Message Two, providing the messages IDs. The first message ID should be the older message and the second one the newer. Arguments: - <one> The id of the message to cleanup after. This message won't be deleted. - <two> The id of the message to cleanup before. This message won't be deleted. - <delete_pinned> Whether to delete pinned messages or not. Defaults to False. Example: - [p]cleanup between 123456789123456789 987654321987654321 Usage: ,purge between purge mine Description: Removes my messages from the channel. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge mine 10 - [p]purge mine 2000 Usage: ,purge mine purge contains Description: Removes all messages containing a text. The text must be at least 3 characters long. Arguments: - <text> : the text to be removed. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge contains hi - [p]purge contains bye Usage: ,purge contains purge files Description: Removes messages that have attachments in them. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge files 10 - [p]purge files 2000 Usage: ,purge files purge images Description: Removes messages that have embeds or attachments. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge images 10 - [p]purge images 2000 Usage: ,purge images
docs.title: Purge

docs.title: purge links

docs.text: Description: Removes all reactions from messages that have them. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge reactions 10 - [p]purge reactions 200 Usage: ,purge reactions
docs.title: purge reactions

docs.text: Description: Remove messages that meet a criteria from the flags. The following flags are valid. user: Remove messages from the given user. contains: Remove messages that contain a substring. prefix: Remove messages that start with a string. suffix: Remove messages that end with a string. after: Search for messages that come after this message ID. before: Search for messages that come before this message ID. bot: yes Remove messages from bots. (not webhooks!) webhooks: yes Remove messages from webhooks. embeds: yes Remove messages that have embeds. files: yes Remove messages that have attachments. emoji: yes Remove messages that have custom emoji. reactions: yes Remove messages that have reactions. require: any or all Whether any or all flags should be met before deleting messages. Usage: ,purge custom
docs.title: purge custom

docs.text: Description: Removes messages that matches the regex pattern. Arguments: - <pattern> : The regex pattern to match. - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge regex (?i)(h(?:appy) 1 - [p]purge regex (?i)(h(?:appy) 10 Usage: ,purge regex
docs.title: purge regex

docs.text: Description: Removes all messages by the member. Arguments: - <member> : The user to delete messages for. - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge user @member - [p]purge user @member 2000 Usage: ,purge user
docs.title: purge user

docs.text: Description: Removes all messages containing custom emoji. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge emoji 10 - [p]purge emoji 200 Usage: ,purge emoji
docs.title: purge emoji

docs.text: Description: Removes bot messages, optionally takes a prefix argument. Arguments: - <prefix> : The bot's prefix you want to remove. - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. (Defaults to 100) - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge bot - [p]purge bot ? 2000 Usage: ,purge bot
docs.title: purge bot

docs.text: Description: Delete all messages after a specified message. To get a message id, enable developer mode in Discord's settings, 'appearance' tab. Then right click a message and copy its id. Replying to a message will cleanup all messages after it. Arguments: - <message_id> The id of the message to cleanup after. This message won't be deleted. - <delete_pinned> Whether to delete pinned messages or not. Defaults to False Usage: ,purge after
docs.title: purge after

docs.text: Description: Deletes X messages before the specified message. To get a message id, enable developer mode in Discord's settings, 'appearance' tab. Then right click a message and copy its id. Replying to a message will cleanup all messages before it. Arguments: - <message_id> The id of the message to cleanup before. This message won't be deleted. - <number> The max number of messages to cleanup. Must be a positive integer. - <delete_pinned> Whether to delete pinned messages or not. Defaults to False Usage: ,purge before
docs.title: purge before

docs.text: Description: Delete the messages between Message One and Message Two, providing the messages IDs. The first message ID should be the older message and the second one the newer. Arguments: - <one> The id of the message to cleanup after. This message won't be deleted. - <two> The id of the message to cleanup before. This message won't be deleted. - <delete_pinned> Whether to delete pinned messages or not. Defaults to False. Example: - [p]cleanup between 123456789123456789 987654321987654321 Usage: ,purge between
docs.title: purge between

docs.text: Description: Removes my messages from the channel. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge mine 10 - [p]purge mine 2000 Usage: ,purge mine
docs.title: purge mine

docs.text: Description: Removes all messages containing a text. The text must be at least 3 characters long. Arguments: - <text> : the text to be removed. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge contains hi - [p]purge contains bye Usage: ,purge contains
docs.title: purge contains

docs.text: Description: Removes messages that have attachments in them. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge files 10 - [p]purge files 2000 Usage: ,purge files
docs.title: purge files

docs.text: Description: Removes messages that have embeds or attachments. Arguments: - <number : The number of messages you want to delete. - <channel> : The channel you want to delete messages in. (Defaults to current channel) Examples: - [p]purge images 10 - [p]purge images 2000 Usage: ,purge images
docs.title: purge images

docs.text: QuestionOfTheDay Help qotd Description: Base for all question of the day commands. Usage: ,qotd qotd posthere Description: Set the current channel as where QOTDs should be posted. Usage: ,qotd posthere qotd post Description: Post a question immediately. A question will still be sent at the scheduled time if automatic posting is enabled. Usage: ,qotd post qotd postat Description: Set the time to post a QOTD every day in this server. Usage: ,qotd postat qotd toggle Description: Turn on or off automatic posting of questions of the day in this server. Usage: ,qotd toggle qotd approve Description: Approve a suggestion using its id (see qotd suggestions). This adds the suggestion to the main queue. Usage: ,qotd approve qotd deny Description: Decline a suggestion and remove it from the suggestion queue. For the suggestion's id, see qotd suggestions. Usage: ,qotd deny qotd list Description: Show questions in the main queue. Usage: ,qotd list qotd add Description: Add a question directly to the main queue (requires elevated permissions). Usage: ,qotd add qotd suggestions Description: View all questions in the suggestion queue. Usage: ,qotd suggestions qotd remove Description: Remove a question from the queue using its id (see qotd list ). Usage: ,qotd remove qotd suggest Description: Add a question to the suggestion queue (it can be approved or denied by moderators). Usage: ,qotd suggest

docs.text: Quiz Help Play a kahoot-like trivia game with questions from Open Trivia Database. Originally by Keane for Red v2 quiz Description: Play a kahoot-like trivia game. Questions from the Open Trivia Database. In this game, you will compete with other players to correctly answer each question as quickly as you can. You have 10 seconds to type the answer choice before time runs out. The longer you take to say the right answer, the fewer points you get. If you get it wrong, you get no points. Only the first valid answer (A, B, C, or D) will be recorded - be sure of the answer before replying! To end the game, stop responding to the questions and the game will time out. Usage: ,quiz quiz categories Description: List quiz categories. Usage: ,quiz categories quiz play Description: Create or join a quiz game. Specify a category name or ID number, otherwise it will be random. Use [p]quiz categories to list category names or id numbers. Usage: ,quiz play quizset Description: Quiz settings. Usage: ,quizset quizset afk Description: Set number of questions before the game ends due to non-answers. Usage: ,quizset afk quizset show Description: Toggle revealing the answers. Usage: ,quizset show quizset questions Description: Set number of questions per game. Usage: ,quizset questions quizset multiplier Description: Set the credit multiplier. The accepted range is 0 - 10000. 0 will turn credit gain off. Credit gain will be based on the number of questions set and user speed. 1x = A small amount of credits like 1-10. 100x = A handful of credits: 100-500. 10000x = Quite a lot of credits, around 10k to 50k. Usage: ,quizset multiplier
docs.title: Quiz

docs.text: RandomTopic Help A cog to send random topics at configurable intervals. rt Description: Commands to configure Random Topic. Usage: ,rt rt setrole Description: Set the role to be pinged when a new topic is posted. Use this command to specify which role should be mentioned whenever a new random topic is generated and sent to the channel. Usage: ,rt setrole rt settitle Description: Set the title for the Random Topic embed. Use this command to customize the title that will appear in the random topic embeds. Usage: ,rt settitle rt setinterval Description: Set the interval for sending random topics (in minutes). Use this command to set the interval at which the bot will send random topics. Usage: ,rt setinterval rt setchannel Description: Set the channel where random topics will be sent. Use this command to specify which text channel the bot should use to send the random topics. Make sure to mention the channel. Usage: ,rt setchannel

docs.text: ReactLog Help Log when reactions are added or removed. reactlog Description: Reaction logging configuration commands. Usage: ,reactlog reactlog settings Description: Show current reaction log settings. Usage: ,reactlog settings reactlog reactadd Description: Enable/disable logging when reactions added. Usage: ,reactlog reactadd reactlog logall Description: Set whether to log all reactions or not. If enabled, all reactions will be logged. If disabled, only first added or last removed reactions will be logged. Just a gentle reminder, it would be spammy if enabled. Usage: ,reactlog logall reactlog grouped Description: Set whether to group reaction logging embeds. This is useful if your bot is in many servers and has a lot of users. Usage: ,reactlog grouped reactlog reactdel Description: Enable/disable logging when reactions removed. Usage: ,reactlog reactdel reactlog channel Description: Set the reactions logging channel. Usage: ,reactlog channel reactlog blacklist Description: Add/remove a member from reactlog blacklist. Usage: ,reactlog blacklist reactlog blacklist add Description: Add a member to reactlog blacklist. Usage: ,reactlog blacklist add reactlog blacklist remove Description: Remove a member from reactlog blacklist. Usage: ,reactlog blacklist remove reactlog ignore Description: Add/remove a channel from reactlog ignore list. Usage: ,reactlog ignore reactlog ignore add Description: Add a channel to reactlog ignore list. Usage: ,reactlog ignore add reactlog ignore remove Description: Remove a channel from reactlog ignore list. Usage: ,reactlog ignore remove

Usage: ,redditset redditset credentials Description: Sets the credentials needed to access Reddit's API NOTE: This command should be done in a DM with the bot. You can obtain your client id and secret by creating an app at https://www.reddit.com/prefs/apps Set the application url to http://127.0.0.1 and set the app type to script. The username and password are the username and password for the account you created the app (using the above instructions) on. Be sure to enter them in the correct order. Failing to do so will cause the commands to fail Usage: ,redditset credentials

docs.text: Reminders Help Don't forget anything anymore! Reminders in DMs, channels, FIFO commands scheduler, say scheduler... With 'Me Too', snooze and buttons. remindme Description: Create a reminder with optional reminder text or message. The specified time can be fuzzy parsed or use the kwargs in , on and every to find a repeat rule and your text. You don't have to put quotes around the time argument. For more precise parsing, you can place quotation marks around the text. Put quotation marks around the time too, if it contains spaces. Use [p]reminder timetips to display tips for time parsing. Examples: - [p]remindme in 8min45sec to do that thing - [p]remindme to water my plants in 2 hours - [p]remindme in 3 days - [p]remindme 8h - [p]remindme every 1 week to take out the trash - [p]remindme in 1 hour <message_link> - [p]remindme at 10h to add some feature to my codes Usage: ,remindme remind Description: Create a reminder with optional reminder text or message, in a channel with an user/role ping. The specified time can be fuzzy parsed or use the kwargs in , on and every to find a repeat rule and your text. You don't have to put quotes around the time argument. For more precise parsing, you can place quotation marks around the text. Put quotation marks around the time too, if it contains spaces. Use [p]reminder timetips to display tips for time parsing. Examples: - [p]remind #destination @user1 @user2 @user2 in 2 hours to buy a gift Usage: ,remind reminder Description: List, edit and delete existing reminders, or create FIFO/commands or Say reminders. Usage: ,reminder reminder timetips Description: Show time parsing tips. Usage: ,reminder timetips reminder remove Description: Remove existing Reminder(s) from their IDs. Use last to remove your last created reminder. Use next to remove your next triggered reminder. Usage: ,reminder remove reminder say Description: Create a reminder who will say/send text. The specified time can be fuzzy parsed or use the kwargs in , on and every to find a repeat rule and your text. You don't have to put quotes around the time argument. For more precise parsing, you can place quotation marks around the text. Put quotation marks around the time too, if it contains spaces. Use [p]reminder timetips to display tips for time parsing. Examples: - `[p]reminder say #destination "at 9h every day" Hello everyone! Usage: ,reminder say reminder edit Description: Edit an existing Reminder from its ID. Use last to edit your last created reminder. Use next to edit your next triggered reminder. Usage: ,reminder edit reminder text Description: Edit the text of an existing Reminder from its ID. Use last to edit your last created reminder. Use next to edit your next triggered reminder. Usage: ,reminder text reminder timezone Description: Set your timezone for the time converter. Timezone should be specified in the format: Continent/City . Example: Europe/Paris , America/New_York ... You can find a list of valid timezones at: https://timezonedb.com/time-zones. Usage: ,reminder timezone reminder repeat Description: Edit the repeat of an existing Reminder from its ID. Use last to edit your last created reminder. Use next to edit your next triggered reminder. Allowed intervals are: • years / year / y • months / month / mo • weeks / week / w • days / day / d • hours / hour / hrs / hr / h • minutes / minute / mins / min / m You can combine relative intervals like this: • 1y 1mo 2 days -5h Usage: ,reminder repeat reminder fifo Description: Create a FIFO/command reminder. The chosen command will be executed with you as invoker. Don't provide the prefix. The specified time can be fuzzy parsed or use the kwargs in , on and every to find a repeat rule and your text. You don't have to put quotes around the time argument. For more precise parsing, you can place quotation marks around the text. Put quotation marks around the time too, if it contains spaces. Use [p]reminder timetips to display tips for time parsing. Examples: - `[p]reminder fifo #destination "at 10h every day" ping Usage: ,reminder fifo reminder list Description: List your existing reminders. Sort options: - expire : Display them in order of next triggering. - created : Display them in order of creating. - id : Display them in order of their ID. Usage: ,reminder list reminder expires Description: Edit the expires time of an existing Reminder from its ID. Use last to edit your last created reminder. Use next to edit your next triggered reminder. It's the same converter as for creation, but without the option of repetition. Usage: ,reminder expires reminder clear Description: Clear all your existing reminders. Usage: ,reminder clear reminder timestamps Description: Get a list of Discord timestamps for a given time. You can provide a repeat. The specified time can be fuzzy parsed or use the kwargs in , on and every to find a repeat rule. You don't have to put quotes around the time argument. Use [p]reminder timetips to display tips for time parsing. Usage: ,reminder timestamps setreminders Description: Configure Reminders. Usage: ,setreminders setreminders modalconfig Description: Set all settings for the cog with a Discord Modal. Usage: ,setreminders modalconfig setreminders secondsallowed Description: Check reminders every 30 seconds instead of every 1 minute, to allow reminders with precise duration. Default value: True Dev: <class 'bool'> Usage: ,setreminders secondsallowed setreminders metoo Description: Show a Me too button in reminders. Default value: True Dev: <class 'bool'> Usage: ,setreminders metoo setreminders repeatallowed Description: Enable or disabled repeat option for users (except bot owners). Default value: True Dev: <class 'bool'> Usage: ,setreminders repeatallowed setreminders migratefromremindme Description: Migrate Reminders from RemindMe by PhasecoreX. Usage: ,setreminders migratefromremindme setreminders migratefromfifo Description: Migrate Reminders from FIFO by Fox. Usage: ,setreminders migratefromfifo setreminders showsettings Description: Show all settings for the cog with defaults and values. Usage: ,setreminders showsettings setreminders minimumrepeat Description: Change the minimum minutes number for a repeat time. Default value: 60 Dev: Range[int, 10, None] Usage: ,setreminders minimumrepeat setreminders snoozeview Description: Send Snooze view/buttons when reminders sending. Default value: True Dev: <class 'bool'> Usage: ,setreminders snoozeview setreminders resetsetting Description: Reset a setting. Usage: ,setreminders resetsetting setreminders fifoallowed Description: Allow or deny commands reminders for users (except bot owners). Default value: False Dev: <class 'bool'> Usage: ,setreminders fifoallowed setreminders maximumuserreminders Description: Change the reminders limit for each user (except bot owners). Default value: 20 Dev: Range[int, 1, 125] Usage: ,setreminders maximumuserreminders setreminders creationview Description: Send Creation view/buttons when reminders creation. Default value: True Dev: <class 'bool'> Usage: ,setreminders creationview setreminders clearuserreminders Description: Clear all existing reminders for a user. Usage: ,setreminders clearuserreminders

docs.text: Reports Help Create user reports that server staff can respond to. Users can open reports using [p]report . These are then sent to a channel in the server for staff, and the report creator gets a DM. Both can be used to communicate. reportset Description: Manage Reports. Usage: ,reportset reportset toggle Description: Enable or disable reporting for this server. Usage: ,reportset toggle reportset output Description: Set the channel where reports will be sent. Usage: ,reportset output report Description: Send a report. Use without arguments for interactive reporting, or do [p]report [text] to use it non-interactively. Usage: ,report report interact Description: Open a message tunnel. This tunnel will forward things you say in this channel or thread to the ticket opener's direct messages. Tunnels do not persist across bot restarts. Usage: ,report interact
docs.title: Reports

docs.text: Rift Help Communicate with other servers/channels. send Description: Send a message to the specified destinations. Editing or deleting the message you send will still forward to the bot's reposts, as in normal rifts. Usage: ,send rift Description: Communicate with other channels through Red. Usage: ,rift rift web Description: Opens up all possible connections between this channel and the specified rifts. See the helptext of [p]rift link for more info. Usage: ,rift web rift open Description: Opens a rift to the specified destination(s). Only your messages will be forwarded to the specified destinations, and all replies will be sent back to you. Usage: ,rift open rift notify Description: Toggle whether the bot notifies the destination of an open rift. The notification is only disabled for bot owners, and will still notify channels the bot owner doesn't have direct access to. Usage: ,rift notify rift info Description: Provides info about rifts opened in the specified scope. Usage: ,rift info rift close Description: Closes all rifts that lead to this channel. Usage: ,rift close rift close guild Description: Closes all rifts that lead to this server. Usage: ,rift close guild rift link Description: Links this channel to the specified destination(s). Anything anyone says in this channel will be forwarded. All replies will be relayed back here. Usage: ,rift link rift blocklist Description: Configures blocklists. Blocklisted destinations cannot have rifts opened to them. Usage: ,rift blocklist rift blocklist server Description: Blocklists the current server. All channels and members in a server are considered blocklisted if the server is blocklisted. Members can still be reached if they are in another, non-blocklisted server. Usage: ,rift blocklist server rift blocklist channel Description: Blocklists the current channel or the specified channel. Can also blocklist DM channels. Usage: ,rift blocklist channel

docs.text: RoleNotify Help Notify a user when they have a Role added or removed from them More detailed docs: https://cogs.yamikaitou.dev/rolenotify.html rolenotify Description: Configure RoleNotify Usage: ,rolenotify rolenotify role Description: Configure settings for a Role Usage: ,rolenotify role rolenotify role message Description: Set the notification message can be either `add` or `remove` Formatting options available for are {role_name} = Role Name {role_mention} = Role Mention (will not ping) {user_name} = User's Display Name {user_mention} = User Mention **Usage:** `,rolenotify role message` ### rolenotify role info **Description:** Display the configured settings for a Role **Usage:** `,rolenotify role info` ### rolenotify role add **Description:** Set if the notification should be sent on Role Add should be any of these combinations, `on/off`, `yes/no`, `1/0`, `true/false` **Usage:** `,rolenotify role add` ### rolenotify role method **Description:** Set the notification method Valid options are `dm` and `channel` **Usage:** `,rolenotify role method` ### rolenotify role remove **Description:** Set if the notification should be sent on Role Remove should be any of these combinations, `on/off`, `yes/no`, `1/0`, `true/false` **Usage:** `,rolenotify role remove` ### rolenotify role channel **Description:** Set the channel to output Role Notifications to Pass 0 to clear the channel and use the server defined channel **Usage:** `,rolenotify role channel` ### rolenotify channel **Description:** Set the channel to output Role Notifications to Pass 0 to clear the channel Pass nothing to see the configured channel **Usage:** `,rolenotify channel`
docs.title: RoleNotify

docs.text: Description: Configure settings for a Role Usage: ,rolenotify role
docs.title: rolenotify role

docs.text: Description: Set the notification message can be either `add` or `remove` Formatting options available for are {role_name} = Role Name {role_mention} = Role Mention (will not ping) {user_name} = User's Display Name {user_mention} = User Mention **Usage:** `,rolenotify role message` ### rolenotify role info **Description:** Display the configured settings for a Role **Usage:** `,rolenotify role info` ### rolenotify role add **Description:** Set if the notification should be sent on Role Add should be any of these combinations, `on/off`, `yes/no`, `1/0`, `true/false` **Usage:** `,rolenotify role add` ### rolenotify role method **Description:** Set the notification method Valid options are `dm` and `channel` **Usage:** `,rolenotify role method` ### rolenotify role remove **Description:** Set if the notification should be sent on Role Remove should be any of these combinations, `on/off`, `yes/no`, `1/0`, `true/false` **Usage:** `,rolenotify role remove` ### rolenotify role channel **Description:** Set the channel to output Role Notifications to Pass 0 to clear the channel and use the server defined channel **Usage:** `,rolenotify role channel` ### rolenotify channel **Description:** Set the channel to output Role Notifications to Pass 0 to clear the channel Pass nothing to see the configured channel **Usage:** `,rolenotify channel`
docs.title: rolenotify role message

docs.text: RoleRequests Help Adds or removes a role on users by request. request Description: Requests access to a role. Usage: ,request request rem Description: Takes a requestable role. Usage: ,request rem request addrole Description: Adds a role to be requestable. Usage: ,request addrole request add Description: Gives you a requestable role. Usage: ,request add request massadd Description: Adds roles to all users who have participated in a channel within the last X messages. Usage: ,request massadd request clear Description: Clears all requestable roles. Usage: ,request clear request remrole Description: Removes a role from being requestable. Usage: ,request remrole request postlist Description: Lists the roles that can be requested and posts them permanently to the specified channel. Usage: ,request postlist request list Description: Lists the roles that can be requested. Usage: ,request list reqset Description: Adjust [p]request command settings. Usage: ,reqset reqset show_member_count Description: Whether to show or hide the number of users who currently have the role in successful [p]request commands and the role list. For value, pass in "true" or "false". Omit the value to toggle. Using the aliases with "hide" at the start inverts the value passed in. Usage: ,reqset show_member_count reqset request_channel Description: Where [p]request list commands say to use the [p]request command. Use the command without a channel argument to set to no channel. Usage: ,reqset request_channel reqset max_requestable Description: Maximum number of roles that users can request. If set to -1, there is no limit. Usage: ,reqset max_requestable reqset auto_post_list Description: Whether to automatically update existing post_list posts when roles or counts change. For value, pass in "true" or "false". Omit the value to toggle. Usage: ,reqset auto_post_list

docs.text: RoleSync Help A cog that syncs roles and their properties across multiple servers. rolesync Description: Sync role states between guilds Usage: ,rolesync rolesync remove Description: No description provided. Usage: ,rolesync remove rolesync list Description: List synced roles Usage: ,rolesync list rolesync add Description: Add a role to sync between guild The role argument must be a role mention or ID. The guilds argument accepts guild IDs Usage: ,rolesync add rolesync forcesync Description: No description provided. Usage: ,rolesync forcesync
